Authors: Hendersen K., Santosa N., Halim S.S., Wibisurya A.
Title: Mobile-based application development for car and motor rentals
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Hendersen, K., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Santosa, N., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Halim, S.S., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Wibisurya, A., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Many people who have private vehicles do not use their vehicles at all times so that over time the vehicles become poorly maintained and eventually damaged. Online Rental Application is here to help private vehicle owners to maximize the use of their personal vehicles while helping private vehicle owners to earn extra income. The purpose of writing is to develop applications that allow users to choose the vehicle according to their needs and to process the rental of vehicles both motorbikes and cars. The development method used is the waterfall method which consists of communication, planning, modeling, construction, deployment. The results are evaluated with 8 golden rules of interface design and the results of the questionnaire show that the application can be used by users and providers to make the process of renting and renting a vehicle. It was concluded that this application can be used well and can carry out the process of renting and renting vehicles for cars and motorbikes. © 2020 by Advance Scientific Research.
Author Keywords: Marketplace; Mobile Application; Private Vehicle; Rental Online
References: (2017) Smartphone Market Share, , https://www.idc.com/promo/smartphone-market-share/os, IDC, Available; Collins, C, (2012) Simple Fixes for your Car: How to do Small Jobs yourself and Save Money, , England: Veloce Publishing Limited; Kesrarat, D., Songcharoenkit, S., Nanthapornpisut, P., Thawonthammarat, L., (2017) Smart Matching for Car Rental, , Singapore; Whitten, J. Authors: Sasmoko, Halim S.A., Indrianti Y., Udjaja Y., Moniaga J., Makalew B.A.
Title: The repercussions of game multiplayer online battle arena
Source title: Proceeding - 2019 International Conference of Artificial Intelligence and Information Technology, ICAIIT 2019
Affiliations: Primary Teacher Education Department, Faculty of Humanities, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Research Interest Group in Educational Technology, Bina Nusantara Universiy, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Mobile Application and Technology Program, Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sasmoko, Primary Teacher Education Department, Faculty of Humanities, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Halim, S.A., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Indrianti, Y., Research Interest Group in Educational Technology, Bina Nusantara Universiy, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Udjaja, Y., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Moniaga, J., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Makalew, B.A., Mobile Application and Technology Program, Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: In this digital era, games become one of entertainment that knows no age. For students, the game can have a positive impact, namely increasing cognitive and motoric abilities. This research seeks to see the experience of students in Jakarta after playing the DOTA 2 game. DOTA 2 is one of the famous games and one of the games that once recorded a record of making an event with the biggest prize in the world of E-Sport. The research method used is neuroresearch. Data is obtained through questionnaires with user experience indicators. The results of the study show that the graphics and game style are the determinants of user experience where gameplay and the purpose of play are the main indicators of the user experience of this game. © 2019 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Artificial intelligence; Surveys; Digital era; E-sports; Game; Gameplay; Jakarta; Multiplayers; research methods; User experience; Students

Authors: Moniaga J., Indrianti Y., Sasmoko, Halim S.-A.
Title: Statistical learning game application assets for 5th grade elementary school student
Source title: International Journal of Engineering and Technology(UAE)
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Research Interest Group in Educational Technology, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Faculty of Social Podomoro University, Indonesia; Primary Teacher Education Department, Faculty of Humanities, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Moniaga, J., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Indrianti, Y., Research Interest Group in Educational Technology, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia, Faculty of Social Podomoro University, Indonesia; Sasmoko, Research Interest Group in Educational Technology, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia, Primary Teacher Education Department, Faculty of Humanities, Indonesia; Halim, S.-A., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia
Abstract: Mathematics is often identified with difficult subjects, because most people find it difficult to understand mathematics. On the other hand, games can provoke interest in learning and can improve cognitive and motor skills. The research discusses the development of educational games to help learning mathematics in the theme of statistics in 5th grade elementary school student. This educational game is designed with research methods. The application is designed using UNITY to run the program, Paint tool SAI to draw characters, Dragon bones for animation, Adobe Photoshop to create sprite sheet. The results of this research were tried out to students of an elementary school in Jakarta through working on the questions in the game. © 2018 Authors.
